How to Install libresolv-wrapper on debian

  • Home
  • debian
  • libresolv-wrapper

Today in this tutorial, I’ll show you how you can install libresolv-wrapper on debian with and without using the command line.

Introduction

Installing libresolv-wrapper on debian is very easy. And with the help of this tutorial, you will be able to easily install, update and uninstall libresolv-wrapper in just a few steps.

In this tutorial I’ll show you four methods to install libresolv-wrapper, the methods are using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic. All these methods require you to have an active and stable internet connection and sudo permission.

Install libresolv-wrapper Using apt

To install libresolv-wrapper in debian using apt, you will need to run the apt update command first to get the updated list of packages from the repositories.

Copy the command given below and paste it in the command line, then press enter. If you are using the sudo command for the first time then you might also need to enter your root password.

sudo apt update

After you have updated the package list using apt, you can now install libresolv-wrapper using the apt install command. To do that use the command given below.

sudo apt -y install libresolv-wrapper

The installation of libresolv-wrapper might take a little bit of time depending upon your internet connection and machine configuration.

Install libresolv-wrapper Using apt-get

To install libresolv-wrapper using apt-get in debian, you will need to first update the package list using the apt-get update command. Copy, paste, and enter the command given below in the command line.

sudo apt-get update

After updating the package lists, use the apt-get install command given below to install libresolv-wrapper.

sudo apt-get -y install libresolv-wrapper

Install libresolv-wrapper Using Synaptic

To install libresolv-wrapper using Synaptic you will need to first install Synaptic, you can do that by following the instructions from here. After installing synaptic follow the steps below to install libresolv-wrapper on your debian using Synaptic.

You can open synaptic by clicking on the menu icon then searching for synaptic or you can open the command line and enter the command given below –

sudo synaptic

After synaptic opens, click on the search icon and search for libresolv-wrapper. This will display the libresolv-wrapper package in the package window, now to install libresolv-wrapper, click on the checkbox that is on the left side.

Then click on Mark for Installation, this will select the libresolv-wrapper package for installation, now to install it click on the Apply button, you will get a summary window where click on the apply button again to start the download of libresolv-wrapper.

If the download and installation are successful then the checkmark option will turn green.

Install libresolv-wrapper Using aptitude

To install libresolv-wrapper on debian using aptitude, you will need to first install Aptitude in your debian. To install Aptitude follow the instructions here. Once you have aptitude installed proceed to the installation of libresolv-wrapper.

Now you will need to first update your package lists from the repositories, use the apt update command for that, after that update the package list of aptitude using the aptitude update command.

sudo apt update sudo aptitude update

After updating the package list of aptitude, install libresolv-wrapper using the command aptitude install libresolv-wrapper.

sudo aptitude -y install libresolv-wrapper

How to Upgrade libresolv-wrapper on debian

If you want to upgrade the libresolv-wrapper package on your debian to its latest version then here’s how you can do that using apt, apt-get, aptitude, and synaptic.

Upgrade libresolv-wrapper using Apt & Apt-get

To upgrade libresolv-wrapper to its latest version using apt or apt-get, you will need to open the terminal then run the sudo apt update command to update the package list, after that copy and paste the commands given below to upgrade libresolv-wrapper.

sudo apt install --only-upgrade libresolv-wrapper sudo apt-get install --only-upgrade libresolv-wrapper

Upgrade libresolv-wrapper using Aptitude

To upgrade libresolv-wrapper using aptitude you will need to again run the update command to update the package list, use command sudo aptitude update to do that. After that run the command given below to upgrade libresolv-wrapper.

sudo aptitude -y full-upgrade libresolv-wrapper

Upgrade libresolv-wrapper using Synaptic

To upgrade libresolv-wrapper using synaptic open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or by going to the menu and searching for synaptic.

In synaptic click on the reload button, this will look for updates. After that you will need to search for libresolv-wrapper, now right-click libresolv-wrapper, and click on the mark for upgrade option.

Now to upgrade libresolv-wrapper just click on the apply button, then click on the apply button again in the summary screen.

How To Uninstall libresolv-wrapper on debian

If you want to remove and uninstall libresolv-wrapper from your debian then here’s how you can do that. To remove just libresolv-wrapper, you can use the command that is given below, copy the command, paste it in the command line then press enter.

sudo apt remove libresolv-wrapper

Remove related packages, dependencies & configuration files of libresolv-wrapper

To remove all the related packages, dependencies and configuration files of libresolv-wrapper you can use the command given below.

sudo apt -y purge libresolv-wrapper

Remove libresolv-wrapper using Synaptic Package Manager

You can also uninstall libresolv-wrapper using the synaptic package manager, first open synaptic using the command sudo synaptic or search and open it directly.

After that in synaptic search for libresolv-wrapper, right-click the libresolv-wrapper package and click on the Mark for Complete Removal option. Now to uninstall libresolv-wrapper click on the apply button then in summary click on apply again.

Conclusion

That is how you can install libresolv-wrapper on debian using the command line or using the synaptic package manager. I also showed you how you can uninstall and upgrade libresolv-wrapper using the command line or using the synaptic package manager.

If you need any help regarding the installation of libresolv-wrapper then send me a mail at netmikoblog@gmail.com, thank you.
